adjective.description: Forming an essential foundation or starting point; fundamental.
examples: certain basic rules must be obeyed
the laying down of arms is basic to the agreement

adjective.description: Having the properties of a base, or containing a base; having a pH greater than 7.

noun.description: The essential facts or principles of a subject or skill.
examples: learning the basics of the business
storytelling has re-emerged as people have turned back to basics

origin: 1960s: acronym from Beginners' All-purpose Symbolic Instruction Code.
